p: Eryngium L. (Apiaceae) is comprised of approximately 250 species reputed as potential pharmaceutical crops based on their phytochemical constituents and pharmacological potential [ 1]. E. foetidum is an herb indigenous to Central America and West Indies [ 2]. The leaves are often substituted for coriander leaves due to its similar pungent smell [ 3]. E. foetidum is employed in the treatment of diabetes, rheumatism, several anti-inflammatory, respiratory (cold, asthma, cough, sinusitis), and stomach disorders [ 4, 5, 6].
